DataElement.definition: The type of anticipated outcome that is the purpose for medical care.

DataElementConcept.definition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Medical care intended to treat or cure a condition or lessen its symptoms. This includes the administration of drugs, surgical procedures, physical or psychotherapy, or the use of therapeutic devices._An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action.
DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes:
10/10/24 Released per CRDC RFC 68 with CDE 15157467 Procedure Therapeutic Intent Type. mr;

ObjectClass.definition: A particular course of action intended to achieve a result.

Concepts.definition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

Property.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Intent; an anticipated outcome that is intended or that guides your planned actions.

Concepts.definition: An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action.

Medical care intended to treat or cure a condition or lessen its symptoms. This includes the administration of drugs, surgical procedures, physical or psychotherapy, or the use of therapeutic devices.

ConceptualDomain.definition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

ValueDomain.definition: Medical care intended to treat or cure a condition or lessen its symptoms. This includes the administration of drugs, surgical procedures, physical or psychotherapy, or the use of therapeutic devices._An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.
Therapeutic, nutritional, environmental, social and/or behavioral interventions at the societal, community, organizational or individual levels to reduce, modify or stop the course of a disease.

ValueMeaning.definition: The patient- and family-centered active holistic care of patients with advanced, progressive disease. Essential components of palliative care are: pain and symptom control, communication regarding treatment and alternatives, prognosis, and available services, rehabilitation services, care that addresses treatment and palliative concerns, intellectual, emotional, social, and spiritual needs, terminal care, support in bereavement. The goal of palliative care is an achievement of the best quality of life for patients and their families.

Concepts.definition: The patient- and family-centered active holistic care of patients with advanced, progressive disease. Essential components of palliative care are: pain and symptom control, communication regarding treatment and alternatives, prognosis, and available services, rehabilitation services, care that addresses treatment and palliative concerns, intellectual, emotional, social, and spiritual needs, terminal care, support in bereavement. The goal of palliative care is an achievement of the best quality of life for patients and their families.

ValueMeaning.definition: Therapy administered prior to the primary treatment for the purpose of making the primary treatment more effective.
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 7/6/23 Added missing concept to VM per cleanup activities cjl.

Concepts.definition: Therapy administered prior to the primary treatment for the purpose of making the primary treatment more effective.

ValueMeaning.definition: Continuation of treatment for an extended period of time to prevent relapse.

Concepts.definition: Continuation of treatment for an extended period of time to prevent relapse.

ValueMeaning.definition: A therapy designed to cure a condition.

Concepts.definition: A therapy designed to cure a condition.

ValueMeaning.definition: (AD-joo-vant) Treatment given after the primary treatment to increase the chances of a cure. Adjuvant therapy may include chemotherapy, radiation therapy, hormone therapy, or biological therapy.

Concepts.definition: Any therapy that is administered to augment or stimulate other treatment modalities or to minimize or prevent disease recurrence subsequent to the main treatment plan.

ConceptualDomain.definition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

RepresentationTerm.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Intent; an anticipated outcome that is intended or that guides your planned actions.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action.

Medical care intended to treat or cure a condition or lessen its symptoms. This includes the administration of drugs, surgical procedures, physical or psychotherapy, or the use of therapeutic devices.
